articles.title: Particle Accelerator Decodes Lost Ancient Greek Star Catalog - Ground News
articles.description: Researchers led by Victor Gysembergh of CNRS used a synchrotron at SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory to decode erased ancient Greek text from the Codex Climaci Rescriptus, revealing star coordinates from astronomer Hipparchus dating back to around 150 B.C.
articles.content: Using powerful X-rays, researchers at SLAC are trying to recover erased traces of a 2,000-year-old star catalog that could rewrite the early history of astronomy.
